title: The Infotainment Method
subject: How James Bond sells products
author: Ben Settle
body:
Ever notice how James Bond movies sell products?

Bond drinks a specific vodka.

Drives a specific car.

Wears a specific watch.

But here's the thing:

They never stop the movie to tell you about these products.

They just show Bond using them.

Looking cool.

Saving the world.

And suddenly everyone wants that vodka, that car, that watch.

This is called "product placement."

But I call it something else:

Selling without selling.

And it works in email too.

Most email marketers do it wrong.

They stop the entertainment to pitch.

They interrupt the story to sell.

They kill the mood to ask for money.

Meanwhile...

The best email marketers?

They weave the product into the story.

They make the pitch part of the entertainment.

They sell while entertaining, not after.

Just like James Bond.

And when you do this right?

People don't even realize they're being sold to.

They just know they want what you're offering.

This is one of the core techniques I teach in Email Players.

How to entertain and sell simultaneously.

How to make your pitch feel like part of the story.

How to sell like James Bond.

Details here:

www.EmailPlayers.com

Ben Settle

P.S. Tomorrow I'll show you the "anti-Bond" method that works even better for certain products.

Stay tuned.

analysis.selling_technique: Teaching-by-example, product as tool to implement lesson
analysis.contrarian_angle: Sell during entertainment, not after it
